resources.string:
My name is Safynaz Tarek Elsagheir, 

I am a holder of B.Sc. degree in Computer and Communication at the faculty of Engineering, Alexandria University, Egypt (2017 – 2022). 

I graduated this spring semester on July, 2022. 

I am a former software engineer at Made in Alexandria Robotics Team in Alexandria, Egypt. 
During my time in the team, I worked in developing a communication system using QT framework and coded in C++ to control an underwater remotely operated vehicle [ROV]. 
This system is developed as part of my work for the 2020- 2021 international MATE ROV competition that took place in America. 

I also interned at IHUB-ASU in Cairo, Egypt, where I got a chance to work with Microsoft’s latest Azure Kinect Developers Kit. The project included utilizing the camera in developing a rehabilitation application. In this project, 
I was responsible for Tracking and visualizing skeletons in 2D plane and developing the needed exercises using C# and Visual Studio.
